title: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: In the XML Report Designer editor, when editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. The problem is that the user is left unsure about what action needs to be taken to save or discard the changes. The error message is also not very clear, being titled 'Error'. The complete error message is 'Source page is dirty.'
OB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view
EB: After editing the XML in the 'source' view, the user should be able to switch back to the Layout view without any error message being displayed. If there are unsaved changes, a clear prompt should be provided to save or discard the changes.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer.
2. Switch to the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
3. Modify the XML content.
4. Try to switch back to the Layout view.
5. Verify that no error message about unsaved changes is displayed.
6. If there are unsaved changes, make sure there is a prompt to save or discard them.
